meanings.definition: A plant of the goosefoot family, typically with edible leaves.
meanings.sent1: The oraches in the garden are perfect for a salad.
meanings.sent2: I picked some oraches to add to my sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The oraches in the salad started dancing when the music played.
meanings.sent4: Her love for oraches was as deep as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the oraches made the dish look irresistible.

meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Atriplex, often found in coastal areas.
meanings.sent1: The oraches by the beach sway gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: Seagulls often peck at the oraches growing near the shore.
meanings.sent3: The oraches at the coast told jokes to the seashells.
meanings.sent4: The oraches stood tall like guardians of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The salty air mingled with the scent of the oraches, creating a unique aroma.

meanings.definition: A type of herb used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: The chef sprinkled some oraches into the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent2: Oraches are a key ingredient in many Mediterranean dishes.
meanings.sent3: The oraches in the kitchen liked to gossip with the spices.
meanings.sent4: Her culinary skills blossomed with the addition of oraches.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the simmering oraches filled the room with warmth.
